intro: Discocactus flagriformis, commonly known as the flame-shaped cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique, spiny, ribbed stems that form a compact, globular shape. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the warm season, which are typically short-lived but striking. Its adaptations include thick, fleshy stems for water storage and spines for protection against herbivores. Discocactus flagriformis is well-suited to full sun and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
